poem:
Title: In Debt's Cold Shadow 

The wolves howl threats at moon-drained men,
Shaping fear in querulous tones,
Their hunger gouged on paper promises.
Mirthless laughter echoes through ghosted halls,
Letters whispering a sandstorm of demands,
An insidious tide gnawing at the edges of sanity.
Silent watchdogs now growl their warning,
Urging the ravenous to recall their humanity,
In the cold shadow of debtor's despair.
